Renewable Energy Generation: The community can be designed to include solar panels, wind turbines, or hydroelectric power sources to generate electricity. This will not only reduce the carbon footprint of the community but also provide a source of income through selling excess energy back to the grid.

Rainwater Harvesting: Rainwater can be collected from roofs and used for irrigation, washing, and even drinking water. This will help conserve water resources and reduce dependence on municipal water supplies.

Composting: The community can establish composting systems to recycle organic waste into nutrient-rich soil. This will reduce the amount of waste sent to landfills and provide a natural fertilizer for community gardens.

Community Gardens: The community can create community gardens where residents can grow their own produce. This will promote healthy eating habits, reduce food miles, and foster a sense of community among residents.

Sustainable Transportation: The community can encourage sustainable transportation options such as biking, walking, or carpooling. This can be achieved by providing bike lanes, pedestrian-friendly sidewalks, and public transportation infrastructure.
